text:
So welcome back to our food
competition on FoodTube. It's been

quite an experience. Jamie and I have
worked our way through a lot of

photos. It's been really, really, really
difficult and we've decided we hate
judging. So the first one is by someone called Herone and came through Instagram.
What's interesting about Herone shot is she shot in black and
white and i think she was probably one of the  two or three only
photos that came through in black-and-white.

It works really, really well. She's titled it
Chinese Food. It's obviously some dim
sum which have been freshly made. They're not cooked yet.

What's lovely about it is the details lovely
and it looks like it's been
shot on a mobile phone I think.
You can see every little detail.

The lighting is beautiful, I mean it's
it's slightly back lit and you want
to eat them. That's the important thing. It's very hard to make uncooked
dim sum
look edible
but, you know, I'd quite happily eat those raw. A really lovely photo.

Next one which we've shortlisted is by
someone called Lottie Loup.
Lottie Loup

has done something slightly different
here which again made her stand out from

from the others. She's added some
typography into this as well with sweet
temptation in sort of
pen. There's a lovely simplicity about this photo.

If if anything it's slightly over exposed
on one side but i think she might've done
that on purpose. It's sort of

worries me slightly but at the same time
doesn't. It's sort of dark and light
maybe that's about sweet temptation. The dark and the light I don't know, but again she was

trying to do something different
and I really liked that she's tried to
do something different and I do want to eat the biscuit. I can see the focus
is on the grains of the sugar on the eat me and you know I do want to
eat you.
It's a really sweet photo and forgive me I have to choose one.
Jamie and i have to choose one and

Herone, if this is the way i say your
name, your dumpings
are going to go through.

So thank you so much everyone. We
just want to give you a big verbal
group hug really for entering
this competition.

It's been so difficult to choose but I
love the fact that there are soo many people out there
taking photos that are food.
I do hope the little masterclasses will help.

and the whole idea really was to
demystify and to simplify what
you're doing. So we'd love to know what you think of the photos we've chosen so
write in the comments below, that's what they're there for. Thank you.

So if you want to look at the other
entries to the competition please click on
the link below.
